file_content.text: I told you we shouldn't be seen talking to each other. You have your reward--go away.
Congratulations. You've helped a delusional maniac remain in power; I hope you're pleased with yourself.
Hurry up and take the brain to Lord Renning before he gets suspicious.
Have you recovered the mutant tuk'ata brain yet? I'm eager to conclude the business we discussed.
As am I. [Give brain]
Excellent. This chemical will make it appear as though Renning is falsifying his research....
There. All that remains is for me to whisper the right words in the wrong ears.
I'm transferring credits to your account now. Give Renning the brain and collect his reward, too. You've made out quite well.
I did this for the greater good of the Empire.
This was about honor.
But you'll take my credits, won't you? Planning to donate them to the Imperial orphanage, hmm?
Can I aid your clever machinations in some other way?
Need anything else?
You've been more than useful. Perhaps another time.
That's all?
When everyone knows Renning's research is faked, even his closest allies will turn their backs on him.
Once he's completely isolated, I'll arrange to be rid of him forever.
This had better work, or else.
Save your tiresome threats. I'll take care of everything.
We shouldn't be seen speaking again--Lord Renning might suspect us. Give him the brain.
Sorry, I'm still hunting the mutant tuk'ata.
I don't have it yet.
The beast is twice the size of a normal tuk'ata. You're obviously not looking hard enough.
Bring the mutant tuk'ata brain to me first and I'll reward you. You'll find the beast in the tomb of Marka Ragnos.
Seeking Lord Renning's lost pet, are you? Don't waste your time. That fool's research is pointless.
I stalk a deadly beast, not some harmless vermin.
I'm not hunting a "pet."
That may be, but you still risk your life for nothing.
Not a very loyal apprentice, are you?
My, such an attitude.
He's my master in title only. He has nothing to teach anyone about the dark side of the Force.
Explain yourself.
My master is insane. Wasn't it obvious when you spoke to him?
Who cares?
Glad to know I'm not the only one who sees through my master's inane babbling.
Renning deludes the Dark Council into believing he's advancing Sith knowledge. The truth is he wastes the Empire's time and resources dissecting mindless animals.
But if his experiments were discredited, he would be banished--and I would be rewarded.
Tell the Dark Council he's insane. I'm sure they'd listen.
Inform his superiors.
Don't be naive. The Dark Council would never believe the word of an apprentice over her master.
Why reveal your plans?
You're just scheming to get rid of your master.
Don't manipulate me.
I have a greater destiny than serving as a research assistant in this pathetic excuse for a laboratory.
Look, just a minor alteration to the mutant tuk'ata's brain would allow me to reveal my master as a fraud.
Bring me the brain before delivering it to Lord Renning, and I'll make it worth your while.
Scheming in the shadows is not my way.
It lacks honor.
All I ask is that you give me the chance to do what we both know is right.
Betraying your master carries considerable risk.
Sounds dangerous.
The greater the risk, the greater the reward--for both of us.
I'll consider it.
You'll earn rewards from both the master and his apprentice. It's a better deal.
That may be possible.
Perfect. Then we have an agreement.
The mutant tuk'ata escaped to the tomb of Marka Ragnos. It's much larger than the others, so it's easy to spot.
Return to me with the brain before you see Lord Renning, and I'll take care of the rest.
I'm assisting my master's experiments. Leave me.
If you value your existence, I recommend you leave this place at once.
Ah, I did get the right holo channel. Excellent. We should make this fast.
What you did for me, moving against Lord Renning, was risky and took vision. Now I hear you're destroying your trials.
I've sent a small gift. A sign of respect and thanks. Never let it be said I was slow to see the next Sith Lord in the making.
It takes foresight to make your alliances early.
You are a smart woman.
I see we are of one mind.
Thank you.
I don't trust you.
There's always the garbage chute if you don't like it.
Be well, Sith, and remember me later.
